name: Doubletree By Hilton at the Entrance to Universal Orlando

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Came down from Toronto with my girlfriend for her birthday from Dec 8 to Dec 11. The purpose of our trip was to visit Universal Studios as my girlfriend hasn't been there in 15 years but for me it was my 6th return to Universal so I've stayed at quite a few different hotels everytime in Orlando.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did not rent a car as reading reviews from this site indicated that parking is roughly $12 per night and since we were only there for 4 days and most of our time would be spent at the parks. As other reviewers mentioned the only reason why they charge for parking is because some guests in the past that didn't stay at the hotel would park in the parking lot, and by charging for parking it reduced the number of non hotel guests parking in the lot.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The taxi ride to the hotel is $45, so round trip would $90.
reviews.title: Old, dated and subpar service

reviews.text: The hotel was absolutely beautiful. Everything was really well decorated for the holidays, and the staff are extremely nice and sincere. They allowed me to check in early at 12:00pm and upgraded our room to the Universal Studios view (if this is free take it, but not worth the extra charge from city view). Upon arrival we were offered the famous Doubletree cookies and everyday we were there we would go to the front desk and ask for more and they were happy to give it to us.
reviews.title: Senior Trip

reviews.text: The room was extremely spacious with a LCD TV, washroom was clean and we had a couch as well. The bed was really comfortable and the cleaning staff were really nice. There is a fridge in the room which is hidden in the cabinet underneath the TV. There is also a safe for your valuables.
reviews.title: Perfect for the job!

reviews.text: The rooms are large, and some have wonderful views. Otherwise, nothing special here. Minimal guest services. Wifi is free only in the lobby and courtyard; in the room it's $9 per hour. The hotel restaurant does not provide room service, although a nearby restaurant does. The staff are very knowledgeable about Universal Studios, but their knowledge of the rest of the area is quite variable from one person to the next. The pool is behind the towers of the hotel, so it's in shadow much of the afternoon. Next time we're in Orlando we'll try another of the numerous lodging choices there.
reviews.title: Just another high-rise hotel

reviews.text: I love this hotel for its comfotable rooms, for its facilities and its location as it is close to the parks, especially recommend breakfast at the hotel because they have a good service ask fot German G. Who can help them choose the most tasty.
reviews.title: The best hotel

reviews.text: Spacious rooms. Starbucks on property (limited hours) and another one about a 5-minute walk (or less) from the main entrance. Cordial, accomodating staff. Limited fitness center, but Bally's is an easy 15-minute walk or 3-minute drive away. Restaurant on property with good breakfast buffett, including made-to-order omelletes, though it is a bit pricey. Gift shop. Small food court. Flat-screen TV. Good bar on property that serves food late. Overall, very pleased. And let's not forget, The Welcome To Doubletree Cookies!
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.text: My Family and I stayed at this Doubletree Hotel for a fun weekend at Universal Studios. Very nice hotel with many things to do on the 1st floor, including a Starbucks, large gift shop, restaurant ( expensive ), business center, small food court and fitness center.
reviews.title: Very nice, close to Universal, but watch the extra fees.

reviews.text: Room was clean and decent size for a family of 4, but noisy with hallway traffic, slamming doors and thin walls. Mini fridge in the room was a nice touch, along with the Evelyn and Crabtree shampoo.
reviews.title: Just an Ok Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Front desk gives you a delicious cookie upon check-in. I loved it.. as far as eating at hotel, I think that you should definitely walk across the street to Fridays to eat! They have an inexpensive breakfast buffet! I only stayed one night so I did not try out the pool or other areas. I believe my room had a fridge, something I definitely needed.
reviews.title: Yummy cookie, eat at Fridays b/c hotel is pricey!

reviews.text: If you rent a car or have access to a car and swipe your room key to enter the parking lot, be aware that they will charge you. A guest informed me of what showed up on their check out bill.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: Stayed here while visiting Universal perfect location can walk to universal if your in good shape and wearing comfy shoes. Staff was freindly and even gave my daughter extra cookies when she asked.
reviews.title: Well located hotel, good acommodations and service.

reviews.text: They only charged us 9 per night to park our car instead of 12 maybe because we are Hilton Honors members.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: I didn't give them 5 stars because I didn't like the fact they they included gratuity when we were having drinks at the bar at night. My daughter wasn't inpressed with the workout room as some of the equipment was broken. Expensive food in food court but gift shop wasn't bad. Very Limited shuttle times
reviews.title: holiday hotel

reviews.text: this was the BEST customer service i have ever had bar none!! a great place - kudos to lurena and team. Would stay here again or host a meeting with no regrets.
reviews.title: GREAT HOTEL AND SERVICE

reviews.text: Being a Doubletree I thought I would know what to expect but was I wrong
reviews.title: Terrible sleeping environment be warned!!! Written by a chiropractor

reviews.text: Terrible , absolutely terrible beds
reviews.title: Great Holiday

reviews.text: They say heavenly but all they did was but a pillow top cover on a horrible mattress .
reviews.title: Convenient to Universal but not a destination

reviews.text: The air condition would cycle every
reviews.title: Great Hotel

aka: Doubletree By Hilton At The Entrance To Universal Orlando Hotel Orlando
